intro: Eria ovata, commonly known as the oval eria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow with a distinct lip, and they bloom in clusters. Eria ovata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
